skill.name: documentation

Use when creating OpenAPI/Swagger specs, generating SDKs, writing user guides, creating README files, documenting architecture, writing design specs, creating ADRs, writing migration guides, or generating changelogs from git commits. No executable code, network calls, file system access, environment variable reads, or command execution. content.user_title: Create Professional API Docs and Technical Guides
content.value_statement: Writing quality documentation takes significant effort and technical expertise. This skill provides proven templates, patterns, and best practices for creating API documentation, changelogs, migration guides, architecture decision records, and technical writing that developers love to use.
actual_capabilities: Create OpenAPI 3.0 and Swagger specifications with complete endpoint documentation
Generate user-friendly changelogs from git commits with categorized changes
Write comprehensive migration guides with before/after code examples
Document architecture decisions using ADR templates with context and consequences
Produce technical design specifications and feature documentation
Create user guides, READMEs, and developer documentation with best practices
limitations: Does not execute git commands or access version control systems directly
Does not generate actual SDK code or code examples beyond documentation
Does not validate OpenAPI specifications against live APIs
Does not interact with external documentation platforms or build systems

use_cases.title: API Documentation
use_cases.description: Create OpenAPI specifications, SDK documentation, and interactive API guides with examples in multiple languages

use_cases.title: User Guides and Manuals
use_cases.description: Write clear user guides, tutorials, and README files following established technical writing patterns

use_cases.title: Architecture Documentation
use_cases.description: Document design decisions, create ADRs, and produce technical design specifications for stakeholders

prompt_templates.title: Basic API Docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an OpenAPI 3.0 specification for the following REST API endpoints: [list endpoints with methods and descriptions]

prompt_templates.title: Changelog
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a user-friendly changelog from these git commits: [paste commit messages]. Group changes by category: features, improvements, bug fixes, and breaking changes.

prompt_templates.title: Migration Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a migration guide for upgrading from version [old] to [new]. Include breaking changes, code examples before and after, and step-by-step upgrade steps.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an Architecture Decision Record for [decision topic]. Include context, problem statement, considered options, chosen solution, and expected consequences.

output_examples.input: Create a changelog for these commits: 'feat: add user authentication', 'fix: resolve login timeout bug', 'feat: add password reset flow', 'perf: improve database query performance'
output: - User authentication system with secure login and session management
- Password reset flow for account recovery
- Fixed timeout issue when logging in
- Faster database queries for improved response times

best_practices: Include real working code examples, not placeholders, to help users understand implementation
Document error cases and responses alongside successful scenarios for complete API coverage
Structure documentation with clear hierarchy using tables of contents and cross-references
anti_patterns: Using technical jargon without explanation when writing for general users
Writing documentation after code is complete instead of during development
Including internal refactoring commits in user-facing changelogs

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All provide similar documentation generation capabilities.

faq.question: What documentation formats are supported?
faq.answer: OpenAPI/Swagger YAML, Markdown templates, conventional changelog format, and REST API documentation.

faq.question: Does this skill access my git repository?
faq.answer: No. You provide commit messages or descriptions, and the skill formats them into documentation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no network access or file system operations on your machine.

faq.question: Can this skill validate my API specification?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates documentation content but does not validate specifications against live APIs.

faq.question: How is this different from other documentation tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered content generation using proven templates rather than static documentation generators.
